Scripts.OnMouseDown: if ( button == "LeftButton" ) then if (not InCombatLockdown()) then if ( IsShiftKeyDown() and strsub(self:GetName(), 1, 7) ~= "CT_RAMT" and strsub(self:GetName(), 1, 7) ~= "CT_RAPT" ) then CT_RA_DragAllWindows(self, 1); self.dragall = 1; end end self:StartMoving(); end

Scripts.OnAttributeChanged:
-- OnAttributeChanged(self, name, value) if ( name ~= "unit" ) then return; end
-- Based on observations using a print(), this OnAttributeChanged is getting -- called 6 times per group. -- -- The first 4 times, 'value' is the unit (or nil) already assigned to the frame. -- The next 2 times, 'value' is the unit (or nil) that should be assigned to the frame. -- -- Because of the 4 times that it gets called using the existing units assigned -- to the frame, we have to prevent these old unit calls from overwriting the frame -- assigned to the new unit when the new unit was assigned during a previous -- OnAttributeChanged call. -- -- For example, consider this sequence of calls to OnAttributeChanged: -- a) 4 times with self == CT_RAGroup1UnitButton2, name == "unit", value == nil -- b) 2 times with self == CT_RAGroup1UnitButton2, name == "unit", value == "raid2" -- c) 4 times with self == CT_RAGroup7UnitButton1, name == "unit", value == "raid2" -- d) 2 times with self == CT_RAGroup7UnitButton1, name == "unit", value == nil -- -- In (a) it is passing us the unit currently assigned to the frame at the time. -- The nil unit indicates that there is no unit assigned to the frame. -- -- In (b) it is passing us the new unit being assigned to the frame. This is the frame -- that we want to keep associated with the unit. -- -- In (c) it is passing us the unit that was assigned to the frame. In this case -- the unit it has passed us has already been reassigned to a different frame in (b). -- We need to make sure during (c) that we don't try to assign (c)'s frame to the -- unit, since that would overwrite the assignment that the game made during (b). -- -- In (d) it is passing us the new unit being assigned to the frame. In this case -- a nil unit is being assigned. -- -- Because the units are changed one at a time we will be receiving multiple -- OnAttributeChanged calls. Some units may be assigned to zero, one, or two -- frames for a period of time. Once all of the OnAttributeChanged calls have -- finished, each unit should only be assigned to one frame.
local resetFrameMap; do if (self:GetName() == "CT_RAGroup1UnitButton1") then -- Reset the unit-to-frame table when unit assignments start (ie. the first time -- that group 1 unit button 1 is assigned a unit during this series of assignments). -- We have to reset the table so that there is no frame associated with -- each unit when we start. An old frame assignment in a frame we are yet to -- be notified about might otherwise prevent us from assigning the unit's new -- frame to our table. if (resetFrameMap == nil or resetFrameMap == true) then resetFrameMap = false; for unit, frame in pairs(CT_RA_UnitIDFrameMap) do CT_RA_UnitIDFrameMap[unit] = nil; end end else -- Set flag to reset the unit-to-frame table the next time unit assignments start over. resetFrameMap = true; end
-- Remove all units that refer to this frame. for unit, frame in pairs(CT_RA_UnitIDFrameMap) do if (frame == self) then CT_RA_UnitIDFrameMap[unit] = nil; end end
if (value) then -- We have a unit for this frame. if (not CT_RA_UnitIDFrameMap[value]) then -- The unit has not been assigned to a frame yet. -- Associate this frame with this unit. CT_RA_UnitIDFrameMap[value] = self; else -- The unit has already been assigned to a frame. -- This OnAttributeChanged call involves the frame that this unit was originally assigned to. -- The unit has already been assigned to another frame during an earlier OnAttributeChanged call. -- This script will soon be getting called with the new unit for this frame. end self.id = value:match("^raid(%d+)$"); self.frameParent.hasMembers = true; else -- We don't have a unit for this frame. self.id = nil; if ( not self.frameParent:GetAttribute("child1"):IsShown() ) then self.frameParent.hasMembers = nil; end end CT_RA_UpdateGroupVisibility(self.frameParent.id); end

Scripts.OnEnter: GameTooltip:SetOwner(self, "ANCHOR_RIGHT"); GameTooltip:SetText("Left-click to drag\nRight-click to reset");
